meanings.definition: To examine by touch, especially for medical purposes.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will palpate your stomach to check for any pain.
meanings.sent2: She gently palpated the patient's arm to feel for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to palpate the mysterious object with its paws.
meanings.sent4: His intuition seemed to palpate the truth hidden beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: Palpate the dough to see if it has risen enough for baking.

meanings.definition: To touch or feel (something) with the hands.
meanings.sent1: Children love to palpate different textures to explore the world around them.
meanings.sent2: She paused to palpate the soft fabric of the new dress.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to palpate the ingredients carefully to create the perfect dish.
meanings.sent4: His fingers seemed to palpate the emotions hidden in the music.
meanings.sent5: Palpate the soil to determine its moisture content before planting.
